Center for Literacy     Search the site     Toggle Menu      Search                  Center for Literacy      Center for Literacy   Main Menu    Get Involved           Donate    Volunteer    Partner With Us    Research Collaborations    Get Updates         WHAT WE DO           Services    Current Research    Events/Calendar         Publications           Literacies Across the Lifespan    Early Childhood Literacy    English Learners & Literacy    Other Literacy-Related Issues         About Us           CFL History And Mission    Community Supporters    Advisory Council    CFL Team         Impact           Annual Reports         News           Lit News    Lit News Archive    Categories    Social Media          Eyebrow menu    Giving    Events    Contact Us    UIC Careers    CFL Careers    UIC menu    UIC.edu    Campus Map       Search                              Center for Literacy       Center for Literacy  Strengthening Communities and Families                    Resources         COVID-19 RESOURCES               CFL NEWSLETTER            The UIC Center for Literacy is a thought leadership organization dedicated to serving the community through research, advocacy, and lifelong learning.        2061   Families received
personalized resources
to support children with
developmental delays in 2019         7137   Families
served by UIC Center for Literacy in 2019         1650   Children receiving
summer literacy instruction in 2019             GET INVOLVED AND BE A PROUD CFL SPONSOR         Read More           Donate Now            CFL Departments        FAST Program  FAmily STart (FAST) Learning and Support Services empowers and strengthens Chicago Early Learning families.       RCADD  The Resource Center for Autism and Developmental Delays provides support for those who care for, teach and serve children with an Autism Spectrum Disorder or other developmental delays.       Social Service Program  The Social Service Program provides training for Chicago Early Learning families and staff.       Parent & Youth Outreach program  The Parent & Youth Outreach program provides workshops, resources, and special events for Chicago Early Learning families (Parents & Youth) and community-based organizations.       Community Engagement  The CFL Community Engagement office provides opportunities to get involved with short-term & long-term volunteer service projects at Center programs.          Student Experience    “For me, the English classes are very important because they helped me a lot. Now I am more independent; I can go to the store and buy what I need because I can communicate more with people.”    Maria M. | FAST Adult Education student          Upcoming Events                News            Free Live Online Webinars: Autism Aware Month 2020!
